subject: Pro plus pedals
description_text:
Hi,

I recently recieved my pro plus pedals a couple of days ago. There isnt any additional springs in the kit for the brake pedal? Should there be any?

Many thanks
Danny

conversations.body_text: Hi Dannyhughes78,    Please provide your order number and we will look it up for you.

Hi my order number is SSN2104 


>
Hi Dannyhughes78,    Hello, the Pro Plus pedals you purchased do not come with additional springs. Only the Plus X pedals come with additional springs.

Ok no problem thank you. 

Is there anyway of making the brake pedal softer? Even with the red elastomers fitted the brake pedal is very very hard 

Thank you
Sent from my iPhone

>

Hi Dannyhughes78, We noticed your feedback that the red damper feels too stiff. Please note that it is a silicone damper, available in standard hardness levels of 60HA, 70HA, and 80HA. The stiffness you feel may be due to a short travel setting. Please refer to the following guide for adjustment.      Our brake spring incorporates a 10 mm travel-limiting spacer, designed primarily to simulate the brake travel of Formula 1 cars.    With the spacer installed, it delivers the short-travel feel typical of F1 braking.    With the spacer removed, the brake pedal travel is increased, making it better suited for rally racing.    Specifications:    Spring length: 16.5 mm    Spacer thickness: 10 mm    Effective travel with spacer: (16.5−10)÷2=3.25 mm(16.5 - 10) ÷ 2 = 3.25\text{ mm}(16.5−10)÷2=3.25 mm   Effective travel without spacer: 16.5÷2=8.25 mm16.5 ÷ 2 = 8.25\text{ mm}16.5÷2=8.25 mm   Removing the spacer significantly increases the spring’s working travel, providing a softer pedal feel that is more suitable for prolonged braking and the varied conditions of rally racing.
